definition: middle of the night/the dead of night
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order
man can conquer nature (idiom); human wisdom can prevail over nature

sentences.english: Detective Barton : And yet, you got engaged to the man who murdered your husband.
sentences.chinese: 不一定，你曾經和謀殺你丈夫的人定了婚。

sentences.english: But someone set a goal and try his best to achieve it.
sentences.chinese: 而系，一個人定咗一個目標，並好努力咁去實現。

sentences.english: If we let the fastest runner set the pace, the others will be left behind.
sentences.chinese: 如果我們讓最快的人定速度，其他人就會跟不上。

sentences.english: Self-reliance robs us of God's good gifts.
sentences.chinese: 人定勝天的想法剝奪我們得到神美好的禮物。

sentences.english: To Spahr, it seemed apparent that a large asteroid was barreling toward Earth.
sentences.chinese: 史巴爾立即人定有顆大體積的小行星正向地球衝來。

sentences.english: I'm fairly stubborn, but I wouldn't try to fight this force. I'd rather use it.
sentences.chinese: 即使我相當頑固，我也不會去爭這個“人定勝天”。

sentences.english: I always believe man can conquer nature.
Appearance so generally people will surrender the world all doubt.
sentences.chinese: 外形如此一般的人定能降服世人的全部人置疑。
